turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to schedule a check-up appointment with Dr. Smith. I'm a new patient.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly help with that. To start, can you please provide your full name and date of birth?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's John Doe, and my birthday is 03/15/1980.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, John. Please hold while I verify your information in our system. ... Okay, I've found your record. Now, let me check Dr. Smith's availability. What days of the week work best for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Honestly, any weekday works, except Wednesdays. I'm usually pretty flexible.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright. I see openings on Monday and Friday next week. How does either of those sound? I have appointments available at 9 AM, 11 AM, and 2 PM on Monday, and 10 AM and 1 PM on Friday.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, none of those times are ideal. Is there any chance of a later appointment on either day? Like, after 3 PM?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I apologize, but Dr. Smith's schedule is completely booked after 3 PM on those days. I can suggest an alternative: Would you like to see another doctor in the practice? We have Dr. Jones with availability at 4 PM on Monday.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's a bit frustrating, but okay. What's the process like for changing doctors? Will they have access to Dr. Smith's records, or will I have to start all over again?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: No worries, we will transfer your information over to Dr. Jones. Dr. Jones should have access to Dr. Smith's notes from her practice in the system. Let me get you scheduled, and I'll send you a confirmation email with all the details. Would that work?
